author: footballfever70
title: HUGE
review:
It is spectacular where LEGO is going in terms of size.  They are making 6-wide trucks and now this 8-wide airplane.  The entire time I was building it I was amazed at how big it is.  The small tail wings on this one were used as the main wings on older planes.  Inside is a large cockpit that fits a pilot and copilot side by side, first-class seating with 5 seats (three that rotate), a coach section with 6 seats, and an area in the back with a flight attendant seat with a beverage cart.

The only bad thing about this set is that there are many large pieces such as the tail and the wings (both wings are part of the same enormous piece)  But other than that I love it.  It is gigantic, and the door mechanisms are clever.

author: st_pete305
title: Good Set, Correct Scale
review:
This set is a great improvement to the scale of the airplanes from the past. The only issue I have with this set is the landing gear; either the wheels fall off or the whole landing gear assembly folds up during contact with the run-way. 

Overall, this set is worth its value in size, playability, and number of pieces.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Quite excellent however lacks a few details
review:
I have always wanted a replica plane from Boeing or Airbus as Lego and this set is a great release by Lego. The detail and scale of the plane gives it its best features. You are able to build the cockpit and the fuselage sections of the aircraft, adding the windows, yellow swivel chairs. In addition, at the rear is a drink trolley. There is depth of detail where there are four large engines, the wheels and best of all, the opening and closing of the two doors, giving the plane overall some realistic aspects.

The major design fault of the set is that it comes in very large pieces. And this is because for Lego to produce a plane of its scale, they use large pieces so that building time plus costs would be lowered. I would have much liked if it came in small parts to add extra finer detail to the wings, front and wing stabilizers but I can see Lego's viewpoint. Moreover, you need to be a bit careful with the doors as if you try to re-adjust the handles, it might break. 

All in all, it is an excellent set - it does very much look like the Airbus A340 and the added painted bird symbol gives it some uniqueness.

author: dr01d3k4
title: HUMANGUS!
review:
Pros:
Big
two doors
Eleven passeneger seats
Tv for the first class seats
Goes great whith the 7894 airport as this could be an international plane and the plane from the airport can be domestic.
Trolloy, whith cups
Cons:
needs more passengers
Neads a co-pilot
neads a steward/ stewardess.
the trolloy falls over whilst the plane is Moving
The landing gear ometimes collapses
score: 10/5
Buy it if you can.

author: Zamees
title: Finally a real minifig scale airliner
review: A long awaited addition to the town airports.  Unfortunately, it requires a larger airport and wider runways.  Only drawbacks were the pre-fabricated wings, tail and cockpit.  The doors are cool.  Having a hard time finding a place to park this monster in my town...

author: mrmitch
title: Enormous Plane - Better than I ever expected!!
review: This plane is the "Bomb" its not too expensive, and you get a great set with alot of cool features. It is fun to build and to play with. I will most likely get the Airport that came out the same year but that is a Santa gift(wife goes crazy when I get sets over $50). Fly it you'll like it-then buy it.

author: sabpol
title: It's Grown on Me
review:
When I went to TRU a few months ago to take advantage of their buy 2 get 1 free sale, I already had my mind set on the Heavy Hauler 7998 and on the Service Station 7993, but I couldn't decide which set to get for the 3rd one.  I have never been a big fan of the LEGO "airplane."  But this was one of the few sets there in the $40 range, so I reluctantly took it off the shelf and brought it home with my other 2 sets.  

The build is nothing much, but the finished product is beautiful.  I've had this plane displayed throughout my home for months now.  It is one the most humorous LEGO sets I have in that I can hardly look at this big plane without smiling.  This set has really grown on me.

All I would have added to it is some more lights.  How many planes have only 3 tiny lights on the entire plane?  But all in all, it's a set well done, with its 4 minifigs, minifig accessories like suitcases and drinking goblets, little sink, and beverage cart with a little hide-out to store said cart.  I have no regrets with this one.

author: elvaro
title: fantastic
review:
I love this PLANE! I think is really really cool. You have the tv and rotatable seats for the first class and normal seats for the second class. There's a trolley, a very detailed cockpit and THE BASIN WITH THE TAP! 

But there were a no. of cons. Lego could have provide a pretty air stewardess miniig instead of the old man. The height of the plane is a little short. They could have make it higher a bit so that people can actually walk from one cabin to another because right now, the ceiling/groin of the plane is actually blocking the minifigs to walk from the cabin to another. 

Overall again, I think this set is really nice. Although it is big, I feel that is actually ok because it is a plane! You can't expect to be small though.

author: benners30
title: wow!
review:
ok i got this set for christmas and wow it just blew me away. all the seating the realalistic engines everything! so heres the pros and cons

pros:
detailed cockpit
excellent playability
pretty good price to pieces ratio
detailed figs
tons of room and seating
kinda swooshable
good airline fleet builder

cons:
sometimes quite flimsy door mechanism
landing gear collapse on soft surfaces
pain to drop

in the end i did a lot of changes i added more seating a better gally and a luggage compartment 

it definetly rates 5/5

author: Jonamaster
title: LOOOOOVVVVEEE IT!!
review:
I got this the day before I went on a Hawaii Vacation.(How appropritate!) It was sooo good... Except for 3 cons..

Pros:
FOUR MINIFIGS WITH RARE PARTS!!
You can put your OTHER minifigs in it! (because it has WAY more then just 4 seats! :D)
It has wheels at the bottom that roll it!
roof comes off so you can see inside! 
Cool     pit!
little staircase to get up to the door of the plane!
EVERYTHING! (except..)

Cons: 
The blue fin at the top falls off alot!
The wings are hard to put on!
theres nails in the     pit!

IGNORE THE CONS!! THIS IS A REALLY GOOD SET!!

author: Barack_Obama
title: Not bad at all
review:
Well the airliners from all the older sets are now officially learjets! I can see where Lego was going with this one. Good design and excellent size. Great cabin and lots of playability.
 
Pros:
Massive
Love the cabin interior, complete with two classes, TV, rinks cart, basin and    suitcase storage and a nice cockpit.
Interesting door design which works great

Cons:
The airstairs are ridiculous
The engines are horrible
The two big nose sections have a small gap between them (at least on mine)
A big airliner with just a few people, one of which is a ground crew staff and then he conveniently takes off his fluorescent jacket and serves drinks in his jet fuel odour! Hmmmm. Airhostess would be great and figures for at least half the seats. Also what is the point of boasting with a two crew cockpit if there is only one pilot.

The set is great, but its just the little things. Recently Lego is becoming more stingy with figures and more reliant on big shaped pieces which kinda defeats the purpose of a building block.

author: TXClark
title: Very Realistic Airplane
review:
Well I recently began to buy a few Lego City items after a 18 year hiatus and I really enjoyed assembling this plane. I like everything about it and it is very realistic. Can't wait to add the Airport (currently under the xmas tree).

I'd like see addition passengers to fill all the empty red seats as well as a co-pilot too. The doors seem brittle but clever.

Now I need more space so I can fly in & out.

author: legofan5445
title: Prefect!
review:
Was pondering a LONG time to get this set (because is was rather pricy in my country) but seeing all the wonderful reviews and the beautiful pictures (it's on my laptop's wallpaper!) i can't stand it and finally bought it! 

1 word, WONDERFUL! could have done with more minifigs though... have to agree, 2007 sets made by Lego were rather stingy with the minifigs, but the design beat the cons flat down! There's even first class! 10/5 set! Get it if you see it before it is gone! (Don't think Lego Direct has this on 2008 catalouges~ Don't miss this!)

author: AMK152
title: Wow wow wow wow
review: Wow wow wow wow. When I first saw that this set was going to come out, I was speechless. It's huge! Finally, on Christmas 2005 I got it. It has double row seating, and has space for passengers to move around! The kitchen area is cool too. My favorite part of it is the realistically made sink. Now the cockpit controls are one of the best features. There is a whole bunch of controls like a real plane! I also like it how there is room for a co pilot! The doors are made realistically too! This thing is huge! It's one of my favorite transportation sets of all Lego transporation set. I highly recommend it for city builders like myself.

author: Pandabaer
title: too big - falls apart
review:
After we built up a few small airplanes my son really wanted this HUGE thing.
But we are rather disappointed by this set.
- almost too big to fly around with 
- wings are too flexible (wobbly during the flight) so engines and the winglets often fall off
- the door mechanisms is clever made like real-  but not stable enough - parts (Arm Mechanical) broken two times
- The landing gear sometimes collapses so we set some extra 2x8 plates between wing and landing gear  
- Some parts like the front and the tail are too big and just one piece 
- Once the airplane is built, the pilot can’t really get out again (see above) and 
- Where is the friendly stewardess and the co-pilot?

Pro
- interior (Trolley, with cups, wash basin Tv)

author: hustla187
title: Great Plane
review: This is a really good set to get because it is unique in many ways like the first class section and the space for storage. The plane is overall very detailed and it is the only set I have on display in my room. 5 out of 5.

author: lego_anakin
title: Welcome to Lego Airways and Cruise Accross the Atlantic with reg 7893
review: This is a beutaful model of an aeroplane to have, interior and cockpit are very realistic but the wheels are bad because on carpet areas they can make the plane slip and sometimes the wheels fall off so that isn,t good is it, but never mind this set has woderful figures to play with and the boarding stairs are good as well doors are okay not that good because they fall off mostly.The suitcases and the storage fall while You are holding it up good for £34.99 it is one of the best lego sets i have ever got I got this as a birthday present in November i Recommend you get this set good price lovely details exellent service for the lego passengers and you EVEN get drinks along with the set so the passengers can enjoy their flight well whaT MORE Can I say

author: donneyboy
title: Big Plane
review:
i got this set in june or july of 2006 and as soon i got to the car i opened it to peer in at the insides, and as soon i got home i built it. it took about 3 or 4 hours to build.

pros-
big
realistic
seats 2 side by side
a lot of seats
good price

cons-
could use 3 or 4 more minifigs
big pieces
none others that i can think of.
overall i give this set a 4.5/5

author: Zapp_Brannigan
title: Liked it at first, then it all went downhill...
review: This set became unenjoyable because its giant size made it next to impossible to play with. The set comes with a pilot, worker, passengers, drinks, sink, cargo hold, TV, stairs and lots of controls. I like all of this. It's the wings itself I don't like. They are weak, undecent and made the plane dwarf my entire city. And to and insult, they bend under the weight of the engines. Why don't they make the wings shaped like real and thicker? Also, why doesn't it come with a feature that the wheels can contract? This makes the set unrealistic in a way. Also, how are the minifigs supposed to fit under the doorways without getting hit in the head? Sure I enjoyed it at first, but as my city started to expand, it took up too much space and there was no need for it. Like I said, I enjoyed the accessories, so I took them out when I put the plane into storage. I also took out the 6x10 plates, which were very useful in building buildings for my city. This set is truly overrated. Pricewise, it's okay, but avoid this set unless you want the accessories, because you'll regret it for its behemoth size.

author: f_man
title: Pretty good set, wouldn't buy it over other sets.
review:
I actually didn't buy this set, I got it in a large collection of my friend's old LEGOs that I bought off of him. But let me get on with the review.


Pros:

Large

Realistic

Lots of Seating

Kid-worthy (It held together quite well during play [but I added 2x8 plates along the bottom for more support)


Cons:

Not enough minifigs

Only one pilot

Interior is too small, especially the doors that minifigs couldn't get through

Big parts, not a really challenging set

The landing gear could use some work so there was only to settings, up and down. 

Landing gear is flimsy


Overall good set for city fans, or action fans, fun to crash plane into buildings :)!

author: DevDevBeck
title: What an huge Plane!
review:
I got this set at legoland, ca in august 2007. I tell you the size of the box tells you nothing of the size of the plane itself.
Pros:
The Plane:  
Excellent design, the drink cart is really cool.
Cool cockpit.

The Loading Zone:
Interesting gangway

The Minifigs:
Rare Pilot Uniform!
Nice Hairpiece on man.

Cons:
Why are the wings one piece?
tail falls off easily.
Landing gear and engines break on carpet.

So all in all, This set is very cool, anybody should get it.

author: cbowers
title: Disappointed
review:
I love the aviation theme for Lego. I think its a great idea. I am not totally on board with the way that the new city them has gone. However, the new vehicles have finally won me over with their widths. They just are'nt as compatible with the old ones...more noticeable in the larger vehicles aka trucks/planes. 

This plane, had a lot of potential. I think its too big though, and not realistic for the scale that lego presents. There is a lot of wasted space....and the pieces are too large. Its a shame to ahve the entire cockpit and tail section as on piece each almost. 

I write this review so late, and apparently too late again as it appears lego will be releasing more plasticy planes on the market. I may not be detered from buying them as I love the airports...but I think more pieces for more building options would just plain and simple be more like LEGO. 

that is all. Not a fantastic build. Good luck building an airport to serve this international jetliner.

author: Z_wing
title: just what a lego city airport needs...
review:
...a passenger plane! :)

figures

price

I recommend this set to any city fan
I hope you found my review helpful

author: IgNaSx
title: GREAT PLANE
review:
it is very good detailed, but it would be better if it had two biger engines on each side of the plane because it looks like an airbus but for airbus those wings are too short so it could have only two engines it would be cooler.

now about the plane:it has 12 seats one of them is for flight attendant 6 for lower class passengers and 5 for higher class passengers. Of those 5 ,3 of them can spin and 2 are regular seats. 

You could takeoff the red cap,orange thingy and the lamps from the blue guy and put him as a co-pilot

Well i like almost everything about the plane exept the bags they fall out in flight XD

author: legokid2296
title: HUGE
review:

Cons:

  • -Stickers
  • -Too many large pieces

Overall a very cool set.  Price was good for a model of this size, as I would have expected such a large set to cost more.

author: Lolbrick
title: To be honest, slightly dull but well worth buying!
review:
Now Lego did a really nice job in designing the new parts for the new airport theme, but frankly I'm dissapointed in that they did such a lazy job on the details.
The inside sure has some nice stuff, but it could be way more for this kind of space but otherwise it's the best plane out there, just should've took the opportunities...

Pros:
Spinning chairs
TV
Lots of seats
Simple but smart design on the stair
Cart with "Food"
Tap
Well constructed cockpit
Nice doors

Cons:
Lack of minifigures
Tap has no sinkhole (Come on, just add a freakin' 1 x 2 Grille Tile)
No toilet, which could've been implemented with this kind of space
Rooftops has problem with comming off without not have an extra piece stuck at the bottom
Could've made alot more considering the size of the plane

If your a fan or Lego Airports, buy this it's the most realistic plane to be out yet, but as stated, they could have worked alot harder on it.

author: legoroblox77
title: Flying Shame
review:
(as I Type This is Sitting Behind Me)

ill Do a Pro Con Review to keep it simple

PROS: Airstairs, Swivel 1st Class Chairs, Food Container, Realistic Doors, Winglets, Lots of Passenger Capacity, Sink, Nice Worker and pilot Tosos

CONS: Tail Breaks Off, Winglets Too Big, Plane is Overall Too big, it Collapsed Right after i built it, Doors Break, Rear fusalage Falls


ADDONS BY ME:Compass in Cockpit, Winglet Vents, Wing Lights Moved,
Changes Flight Attendant Seat into Jumpseat, Superglued it

Where i Got it: Target

Well Thats All

author: vlaky4
title: Wonderful Set
review:
When I was younger, I owned this set and had lots of fun with it, until it fell and I lost all of the pieces. I'd give anything to have it again. It was a bit hard to put toghether, but hey, it was my first lego set. When put together, it is way larger and perhaps better than the new airplane that comes with the new 2010 airport set. There are four minifigures, two passengers, a pilot, and ground crew. Inside the plane, you will find many seats, including a first and economy class. Now for the pros and cons:

 

  • Pros:
  • Big Airplane
  • Four Minifigures
  • First and Economy Class
  • Flight attendant seat
  • Lots of seats
  • In-flight tv screen
  • Two Exits
  • Good Value for Money
  • Cons:
  • Doors break off easily
  • Could use more cabin crew
  •

author: majorgeneral
title: The best Lego passenger aircraft of all time
review:
My lego city airport neads lots of work,but this plane made it bigger

PROS

  • Huge 14 seater airplane.
  • Very realistic
  • Makes other lego airplanes look like private jets
  • 4 fantastic minifigures
  • Boarding stairs
  • Good price

CONS

  • Doors fall off easily

Notes -

  • twn028 looks like Greg Fife from the NTSB
  • Looks like the Airbus a340
  • If you can get this set off ebay,
  • This set is smaller than set 10177

BUY IT

My final rating 5/5

author: Askora09
title: Talk about high flying
review:
Building Experience

                           This set can get a little tricky to build. The doors don't stay on well untill you get the roof on. The inside is very simple to build. The windows surrond both sides of the plane. The cockpit is actually very cool looking and is pretty simple to build.        

                                               Parts

                          I gave this a 4 on parts because it comes w/ a lot of the same windows AND FLAT PIECES. The cockpit and the bottom is pretty nice 'cause you don't find pieces like that much. The wings are nice too.

 

                                              Playability

                                 I gave it a 5 on playability because you can do a lot with it. I use it for a plane 4 the army to paracute out of. I attached some turrets to it from the at-te and had a big battle over the city.

 

                                                Price

                                      For 40 dollars this is a well priced set. You can buy some pun set for 50 or get this at toys r us. your choice.

 

                                              pros

  •                                      good size
  •                                      good price

  •                                      good playability

                                           cons

  •                                        doors fall of
  •                                        wings shouldn't overlap inside
  •                                        roof doesn't stay on
  •                                       bottom is not stable (put 2 by 6 flats on bottom Fixed it:)

author: Legomdrf
title: A great BIG airplane
review:
I don´t actually have this set but a friend has it and he is selling it to me, I build it and played with it for all the day I was at his home and all I can say is that it is an excellent set.

 

Pros:

*Very large

*Can fit like 16 passengers

*Has first and turist class

*Beverage cart

*Two doors

*Stairway to enter the plane

 

Cons:

*No one to pull the beverage cart

*Only one pilot(It fits two)

*The wings block the way in the middle of the seats

 

I would give this set a 5 out of 5.

author: dsdoak
title: A good set overall
review:
I like this set. The plane is absolutely huge and is very sturdy. It has some nice features like the boarding stairs and the beverage cart. It needs at least two or three more minifigures as there is seating for 12 but only two passengers. Some people are bothered by the one-piece wings but I don't really care. The plane has 4 engines and looks a lot nicer than the plane in the airport set released the same year.

Pros

  • Very large
  • Seats 12
  • Serving cart
  • Sturdy
  • Nice doors
  • Attractive

Cons

  • A few stickers
  • Not a lot of assembly required and it can be repetitive
  • Needs more minifigures

This set is a great addition to any city, or to replace the less attractive plane found in the airport set. The price per piece count might seem high, but it contains very large pieces that make it easier for young builders and much more sturdier. It has a few shortcomings that can easily be added from your own collection.

author: craigpowers
title: I never thought I'd buy this set...
review:
...especially after first seeing it when it came out.  My initial impression was that the line between Duplo and Lego had finally been blurred into oblivion.  There were too many big pieces to make this any fun at all.  What was Lego thinking?  I liked the scale, but the nose, tail, and wings were certainly an about-face to everything I had ever come to expect from the company.  Sometimes, in life, the first impression is not always the right one, and the more I would look at this set, the more I wanted to have it; and, now that it is a part of mine and my son's collection, I regard it as one of my favorites.  Why the change of heart?  Simple.  Lego really only made some very large specialty pieces for the set; everything else about it was distinctly Lego, especially the attention to detail and the clever assembly.

Pros

  • Aesthetics/Scale.  The very parts I hated about this plane have become the main reason why I love this set so much.  The sculpted nose, tail and wings lend to a very sleek, fast look, that actually makes the plane look realistic, and that will always be a plus in my book.  I always wanted bigger airplanes from Lego as a kid, and they never really delivered until my son was of age to begin building himself.  The fact that this set exists proves that some wishes are fulfilled, even if they come about 15 years too late.  Finally, Lego made a plane that could fit two pilots side-by-side, and had two rows of passengers WITH an aisle between them.
  • Painted nose/tail assemblies.  Lego did the right thing with this set and had the logos and striping that overran onto the nose and tail sections painted, rather than have you apply them as stickers.  This really gives the plane's color-scheme a more legitimate look, rather than one that is forced on by stickers that may or may not line up properly.  Unfortunately, they didn't have the sense to stick with it, as every airplane since has decals that blend the color schemes onto these parts.
  • Interior.  Although it may not be as polished as it could be (room for a lavatory?), the interior has many nice features, including a detailed cockpit, first class and economy class seating, and a flight-attendant/baggage area to the rear with beverage cart.  Again, given that previous aircraft made by Lego were only wide enough to seat one person and had no aisle, this new scale is a definite bonus for playability and realism.

Cons

  • Where are all the passengers?  Apparently, Lego minifigures must be made of gold or elephant tusks, as the company has certainly sold us short on bodies in this set.  This is a plane begging to be filled with all kinds of characters - and you get two and just one pilot.  What commercial plane doesn't have a co-pilot, at least, and would it really kill Lego to have a flight attendant and one or two more passengers?  Even if it bucked up the original price $15, adding about 4 more characters would have done nothing to hurt the sales of this set, but I'm assuming Lego figured we already had enough eager passengers at home from our other sets, or would be willing to shell out the dough for more (I think they're right about that, but I'd like to believe I have a good argument).
  • Landing gear.  Yes, I fawned over the aesthetics of this airplane already, but I will say that the landing gear is rather atrocious, especially the main gear below the wings.  Lego provided us with functionality, but threw out any appeal in the process.  The gear is sparse, just enough to serve its purpose, and it just hangs there, unable to tuck up, and is really just down-right ugly from all angles.

Apparently I am not the only person who really likes airplanes and happens to like Legos, as this set is very hard to find, and the ones you do come across are quite pricey.  If you are in the market for one, get ready for a bid war that may take you over $100 for a used set, or shell out $200 for a new one (I should have bought 20 of these 5 years ago as an investment).  But I firmly believe that this set is worth the extra you may need to pay to get your hands on it, especially if you like the airport subgroup as this airplane is like the Lego flagship for that.

author: Pharoh_of_Dinosaurs
title: One of my first sets (and reviews)
review:
This is an awesome set. It has a wide variety of peices, it is very fun to play with, when displayed it looks very realistic, and last but not least. . . It's Huge! Also ,as mentioned in the title, it was one of the first sets I got in my Lego superfan era. Anyway, here are the pros & cons 

Pros

  • It looks awesome
  • It's fun to play with
  • It has several nice pieces
  • It's very big (can seat 11 minifigures)
  • Despite the playabillity, it's quite sturdy
  • Mabey this is just me, but I like the design and pieces of the turbines

Cons

There isn't much of a cargo hold. Just a place for 2 suitcases that fall out constantly.

Would it really have killed Lego to put in a couple of extra minifigures? Think, they could have put in a couple of much needed passengers, and mabey a flight attendent or something.

 

Conclusion

Again, this is an awesome set. Pricewise I don't know because I didn't buy it. Any way, if you can find this at a reasonable price, go ahead and buy it. You'll enjoy it greatly.

author: lukethebrickdude
title: A great addition to your City airport
review:
This set is one of my personal favourite LEGO sets of all time. I have had so many memories with it when I was younger, and I still do.

Box/Instructions

The instructions are straight forward and so simple, but there is lots of content packed into a single booklet, and I think that there could be two, rather than just one.

Parts

There are lots of big parts that can take away from the building experience, but they don't always, depending on who you are.

Minifigures

You get a nice range of minifigures, but I would have liked to see a lady stewardess or something included.

The build

The build is a pleasant experience and is actually very quick and easy for the size of set. It took me inbetween 30 minutes to an hour, and it was quite simple.

The completed model

The completed model is HUGE! and I really like how much playability and the amount of realistic features that have been incorportated in ths set. The attention to detail is very impressive and something LEGO doesn't always do is try to focus on this too much.

Overall opinion

This set is just a must-have for any LEGO collector, and it is arguable the best City plane by LEGO.

author: calzonie
title: An Essential Piece of LEGO City
review:
The passenger plane is pretty close to perfection. The first thing you'll probably notice is the sheer size of it. I always remembered it being big, but as I was rebuilding the plane it really dawned on me just how BIG this thing is. The exterior is mostly made up of large specialised parts. They're not parts that you could reuse for many non-airline MOCs, but I don't think it could have been done any other way without a major sacrifice in looks. The interior features an impressive 11 seats for passengers, with a few that swivel in the front section for the "first class" experience.

An obvious complaint someone might have for this set, considering its size and seat count, is the lacking number of minifigures. The only ones included are a pilot, a marshaller, and 2 passengers. But it's almost a blessing in disguise to have so many empty seats. As soon as I finished the set, I went to find some of my favorite figures from my collection to fill the flight to capacity. Having more minifigs included is always nice, but I don't think it needed another handful of random townsfolk using recycled parts when you could fill the space with pretty much anybody that fits inside. That said, it could have benefited from a couple of extra airline workers. The cockpit feels incomplete without the co-pilot, and the beverage cart needs a flight attendant to push it (although the marshaller might be meant to double as a flight attendant, based on the shirt under his vest).

The main issue I take with the build is that the wing piece creates barriers inside the aircraft, and they almost completely box in the middle section. Obviously with it being a toy that has a removable roof, it doesn't really matter if the characters have to do some imaginary jumping to get from one end to the other. But it would have been really cool if there were a clear path all the way through, especially for the aforementioned beverage cart. The only other small problem is that the doors are tricky to open and shut. It's a very tight fit, although that's not necessarily a bad thing.

 

This is a fantastic set that is yet to be matched in both size and quality! If you have enough room for it, I would say it's an essential part of any LEGO city.
